Class Planner

  • java.lang.Object
    • Planner

  • public class Planner
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the planner class which supplies all the methods to handle the tasks which users wish to execute
    Author:
    Sam Liu Student Number: 40984702 Class Name:Planner

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addEvent(java.util.Scanner input)
      This method prompts user to add an event from keyboard and put the event according to date with the correct index through calling findPosition() method
      int binarySearch(Event temp, int first, int last)
      Recusive binary search technique to search if an event object exists in an arraylist, return the index if there is a match
      void deleteEvent(OurDate myDate, OurTime myTime)
      This method take a particular date and time to delete the event that has matching result in the arraylist
      void displayAllEvents()
      this method simply displays every single event object in the arraylist and display them with an enhanced for loop
      void displayEventsDaily(OurDate date)
      this method takes a sepcific date that user wishes to display
      void displayEventsMonthly(int month)
      displays the events of a particular month, an enhanced for loop is used to loop through each event object and find the matching month
      void displayEventsWeekly(OurDate date)
      this method takes a specific date that user wishes to display and calculate which week of the year that date belongs to then it will display the whole week of events that are registered in the array list
      int findPosition(Event e)
      this method find the correct postition where the index should be for an event object, put the event with the correct index in date ascending order
      static void printTitle()
      this static method display the title of the chart that gets printed on console
      void readEventsFromFile(java.util.Scanner input)
      This method uses the scanner to read the txt file line by line and contruct the correct object according to the event type.

    • Method Detail

      • displayEventsMonthly

        public void displayEventsMonthly(int month)
        displays the events of a particular month, an enhanced for loop is used to loop through each event object and find the matching month
        Parameters:
        month - is the month number which user wishes to display events for

      • displayAllEvents

        public void displayAllEvents()
        this method simply displays every single event object in the arraylist and display them with an enhanced for loop

        public static void printTitle()
        this static method display the title of the chart that gets printed on console

        public void displayEventsDaily(OurDate date)
        this method takes a sepcific date that user wishes to display
        Parameters:

      • displayEventsWeekly

        public void displayEventsWeekly(OurDate date)
        this method takes a specific date that user wishes to display and calculate which week of the year that date belongs to then it will display the whole week of events that are registered in the array list
        Parameters:
        date - is the particular date a user wishes to display events for the week where the date belongs to

      • deleteEvent

        public void deleteEvent(OurDate myDate,
                        OurTime myTime)
        This method take a particular date and time to delete the event that has matching result in the arraylist
        Parameters:
        myDate - is the date when the user wishes to delete
        myTime - is the time of that particular date which the user wishes to delete

      • binarySearch

        public int binarySearch(Event temp,
                        int first,
                        int last)
        Recusive binary search technique to search if an event object exists in an arraylist, return the index if there is a match
        Parameters:
        temp - is the event object that binary recusive search works on
        first - is the first index of the elements that binary recursive search works on
        last - is the last index of the elements that binary recursive search works on
        Returns:
        -1 if the element is not found in the arraylist, != -1 when there is a match and return the index of the element in the arraylist

      • findPosition

        public int findPosition(Event e)
        this method find the correct postition where the index should be for an event object, put the event with the correct index in date ascending order
        Parameters:
        e - is the event that is going to be placed into the arraylist
        Returns:
        0 if the operation is success and -1 if the event already exists in the array list

      • addEvent

        public void addEvent(java.util.Scanner input)
        This method prompts user to add an event from keyboard and put the event according to date with the correct index through calling findPosition() method
        Parameters:
        input - is the scanner object that is used to read user input

      • readEventsFromFile

        public void readEventsFromFile(java.util.Scanner input)
        This method uses the scanner to read the txt file line by line and contruct the correct object according to the event type. Then it will add events into the arraylist without sorting. A bubble sort algorithum is then called to put events in arraylist in date ascending order and remove the ones with conflicting time schedule
        Parameters:
        input - is the scanner object that is used to read event.txt file
